text_section1.text: Sometimes, even now, Morgan thinks that it was all just a nightmare, a bad dream. But if it was, what did happen that night? What became of...
No! You - you don't really exist! I'll wake up and you'll vanish! Who - what are you? Why are you here?

text_section2.text: Before you can understand, you must remember...

text_section1.text: The beginning was a mist. Something filled Morgan's room. But only he saw it. And suddenly, the room was gone...

text_section3.text: Yes... yes! Two years ago! I was worried about David! My son!

text_section1.text: Mary, I must be right! I'm a physicist! I work in an atomic plant! Look at him! Reading at the age of one! It's unnatural... frightening!

text_section2.text: But you can't be sure that your work affected you before David was born! You only suspect that David isn't normal!

text_section1.text: But he wasn't normal! I knew it! He wasn't like other boys. He was too clever!
For the moment, Morgan forgot his terror. This time he remembered without being led...
Dad, please. I don't want to go out and play. I'd rather read!

text_section2.text: But who ever heard of a five year old reading about higher mathematics! Why aren't you like other boys!

text_section1.text: That was the day when I lost my temper because I was so frightened of my own son!
Oh, yes, Morgan remembered. He remembered how he had tried to make his son like other men's sons

text_section2.text: I thought you'd like to have him, David. His mother is the pet of the plant. He was born there.

text_section3.text: A dog? For me? Thank you!

text_section1.text: Morgan remembered, and shuddered. He closed his eyes...

text_section2.text: I... I'm back in my own bed! What - what are you trying to do to me? I don't want to remember!

text_section1.text: Is something wrong, son?

text_section2.text: King is coming to the door.

text_section1.text: King? Your dog? How do you know he's here? You don't see him -- he hasn't barked or clawed on the door.
That was the day I knew my son could read his dog's thoughts! I've tried to forget it!
I knew, then! There was a brain on Earth that made all other brains seem childish! I knew the world was in danger!

text_section2.text: And you were right. Such a brain, if it so desired, could rule the Earth. That is why I am here!

text_section1.text: Even on my world we felt the power so I have been sent to take him back to my world. He will be one of us!

text_section2.text: You come from - an advanced world? But ... no! You can't take him away! You can't!

text_section1.text: It will be better so. He will be happy with us. And there will be no danger to your kind.

text_section2.text: No! Whoever you are - whatever you are - you can't take him! I won't let you!

text_section1.text: Panic clutched Morgan like an icy vise. But he was still a father who would fight for his son...

text_section2.text: Where - where are you? I can't see you!

text_section1.text: Your eyes! They - they burn through me!
I can't move! What have you done to me? Come back!
No!
Afterward, the hall was dark, alive with shadows which seemed to clutch hungrily for him, but Morgan was beyond fear. Then...

text_section2.text: It had to be a dream! It had to! My son is still in his bed! I know he is!

text_section1.text: Dad! What is it?
Of course I am, Dad. Is anything wrong?

text_section2.text: No... no! I... I had a dream, it's all right. Everything is all right, as long as you're still here!

text_section1.text: Everything is - just fine. My son is still here.
Your son? But it was not your son for whom I was sent Morgan!
The voice was just a whisper. Only Morgan heard it. Heard it, and began to understand...

text_section2.text: Not - my son? Then - who? You can't mean...

text_section1.text: Morgan could not say the words but he could think...

text_section2.text: No, it - it isn't possible. It can't be that I was wrong, that King, the dog, could get into David's mind, not David into his...

text_section1.text: It couldn't be. Yet King was gone, never to return. The dog which had been born in an atomic plant. So for the rest of his life Morgan will wonder about his - dream.
